title: Ticket #2813: negotiator rejecting jobs because of insufficient priority
description:
The problems encountered below at a site running Condor v7.6.6 were apparently resolved by downgrading the negotiator to v7.6.4. The 7.6.4 negotiator immediately accepted jobs that the 7.6.6 version had been rejecting.

Worried that the negotiator changes #2679 or #2678 pushed in v7.6.5 had some unintended side effect.

Incident Description

All head and compute nodes at LHO, as well as the Condor central manager, were rebooted this morning to apply a kernel security patch. Prior to that, the cluster had been fully loaded, while now it is running at just under 10% of capacity. Jobs are being rejected by the negotiatior: 

[root@condor ~]# tail -f /var/log/condor/NegotiatorLog
01/27/12 15:39:30 (fd:7)     Got NO_MORE_JOBS;  done negotiating
01/27/12 15:39:30 (fd:7)   Negotiating with
magathos@xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx at <y.y.y.y:45385>
01/27/12 15:39:30 (fd:7) 0 seconds so far
01/27/12 15:39:30 (fd:7)     Request 12907655.00000:
01/27/12 15:39:31 (fd:7)       Rejected 12907655.0
magathos@xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx <y.y.y.y:45385>: insufficient priority
01/27/12 15:39:31 (fd:7)     Request 12908931.00000:
01/27/12 15:39:31 (fd:7)       Rejected 12908931.0
magathos@xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx <y.y.y.y:45385>: insufficient priority
01/27/12 15:39:31 (fd:7)     Got NO_MORE_JOBS;  done negotiating
01/27/12 15:39:31 (fd:7)  negotiateWithGroup resources used scheddAds
length 0
01/27/12 15:39:31 (fd:7) ---------- Finished Negotiation Cycle ----------

Resetting a user's priority to 0 using condor_userprio -setprio did not help; neither did clearing /var/lib/condor/spool/Accountantnew.log on the central manager and restarting Condor, or setting 'NEGOTIATOR_IGNORE_USER_PRIORITIES = True'. However, new jobs in both vanilla and standard universes are accepted and execute normally. Attempts with condor_q -analyze just report Reason for last match failure: insufficient priority.

A possibly related issue is that user priorities reported by user_prio are nowhere near in line with the resources used.
remarks:
2012-Feb-08 15:31:41 by eje:
Is there a repro for this that can be posted on this ticket?

2012-Feb-08 15:33:45 by eje:
Also, am I correctly reading that is this a problem only with jobs that were submitted prior to the upgrade, and encountered problems on restart?

2012-Feb-10 14:26:04 by pfc:
Updated priority to match Todd's new scheme (1=fire, 2=soon, 3=time permitting, 4=not yet prioritized, 5=wishlist/ideas).

2012-Feb-15 13:05:48 by nwp:
I tried to reproduce this in a personal condor: Things worked as expected in 7.6.6 and 7.6.4 (there was no difference). Shadows attempted to reconnect; matches were made.

2012-Mar-09 00:45:47 by pfc:
Given that it's working now, and we can't reproduce it easily, I think we've decided to punt on this for now and reopen if it happens again.
creator: tannenba
